ground_truth: At this moment, his attention is drawn to something across the way. While Jeff is continuing his phone conversation, we see the object of his look. He looks up, expectantly. There is almost a touch of eagerness in his expression. Two pretty girls have appeared on the distant roof. They are smiling and talking, although we cannot hear their dialogue. Each wears a terrycloth robe. With their backs to the camera, they take off the robes, slipping them down over their shoulders slowly. Then they spread the robes in front of them, and lie down on the roof, and out of sight. They at least have all of Jeff's attention. Jeff seems a little disappointed. Jeff's eyes become set upon something else in the neighborhood he sees. Jeff's attention is now drawn to another feature of his backyard entertainment. Jeff asks, eagerly and alertly. She gracefully moves across the room to the rhythm of the music and dance, toward the ice box. The camera is now focused on the window of the small building where we earlier saw the girl behind the oscillating fan. Loud ballet music is pouring from her open window. She begins the first graceful movement of a modern ballet interpretation. With her feet still moving, she throws open the door, and then rhythmically moving back to the center of the room, gnaws the chicken bone, occasionally waving it in the air as part of the choreography. She now twirls over toward a table at the other side of the room on which is an open package of bread slices, some butter nearby. The girl, now dressed in dark and revealing leotard, and ballet slippers, has just turned away from a portable record player. With swaying body, she puts down the chicken leg, and gracefully and rhythmically butters a slice of bread. She picks up both bread and chicken leg and continues her interpretive dance, alternately munching the bread and butter and chicken leg. Jeff's eyes drop from the ballet dancer's room to the one underneath. She looks up in the direction of the music and in a calm routine fashion adjusts the volume of her hearing aid. She is a faded, refined type. It is a simple, but broken, melody as if someone was just learning to play the piano, or carefully composing a song. At this moment we hear the sounds of a piano playing. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he sees. It irritates Jeff as he looks in the direction of the new music. On the second floor, a man has entered the living room from a hallway door. We see a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment house. He carries a large aluminum sample case common to salesmen.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: At this moment, Jeff's attention shifts to something across the way. During his phone conversation, he notices two attractive girls on a distant roof. With an eager expression, he sees them smiling and talking, though their dialogue is inaudible. Each wears a terrycloth robe, which they slowly slip off, lying down out of sight. They completely capture Jeff's attention, though he seems a bit disappointed afterward. His focus shifts to another neighborhood feature. Alertly, Jeff follows the movements of a girl dancing to loud ballet music. She moves gracefully to the icebox, then back to the center, incorporating a chicken bone into her modern ballet. She dances toward a table, butters a slice of bread, and continues her interpretive dance, eating both bread and chicken leg. Jeff's gaze drops to the room below, where a refined woman adjusts her hearing aid to the music. A simple, broken piano melody is heard, and Jeff glances irritably toward the new sound. On the second floor, a man enters a living room, carrying a large aluminum sample case typical of salesmen, in a three-story, flat-roofed apartment building.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Jeff is on the phone, but his eyes are drawn to two girls on a distant roof. They smile, talk, remove terrycloth robes, and lie out of sight, capturing his attention. Disappointed, Jeff notices something else. A girl in a nearby building dances to loud ballet music. Wearing a dark leotard and ballet slippers, she moves gracefully, incorporating a chicken leg into her choreography. She butters bread while dancing, alternating between the bread and chicken leg. Jeff then looks to another room below, where a woman adjusts her hearing aid to piano sounds. The broken melody irritates Jeff. A salesman enters the scene, carrying a large aluminum sample case into a three-story apartment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: At this exact moment in time, his attention is drawn irresistibly to something intriguing across the way. While Jeff continues to engage in his phone conversation, the reason for his diverted gaze becomes apparent to us. He looks up, his expression filled with eager anticipation. There is a subtle, almost palpable eagerness in his demeanor. Two attractive young women have appeared on the distant rooftop. They are smiling and conversing animatedly, although their dialogue remains inaudible to us. Each is dressed in a cozy terrycloth robe. With their backs turned to the camera, they slowly slip the robes down over their shoulders. Then, spreading the robes in front of them, they lie down on the roof, vanishing from view. At this point, they have certainly captured all of Jeff's attention. There is a moment where Jeff appears slightly let down. Once again, Jeff's eyes become fixated on yet another interesting sight within his backyard entertainment. His attention is now drawn eagerly to a different feature nearby. Jeff, now alert and intrigued, asks eagerly. The woman gracefully moves across the room, in perfect rhythm to the music and dance, making her way toward the ice box. The camera focuses intently on the window of the small building where earlier, we had seen the girl positioned behind the oscillating fan. Loud, powerful ballet music is pouring vigorously from her open window. She begins the first graceful movements of a modern ballet interpretation. Her feet continue moving as she dramatically throws open the door, rhythmically returning to the center of the room, and gnaws on a chicken bone, occasionally waving it theatrically in the air as part of her choreography. Now, she twirls elegantly over toward a table located on the opposite side of the room, where an open package of bread slices lies, with some butter situated nearby. The girl, now attired in a dark, form-fitting leotard and ballet slippers, has just turned away from a portable record player. With a swaying, fluid motion, she sets down the chicken leg and gracefully butters a slice of bread. She picks up both the bread and chicken leg and continues her interpretive dance, alternating between munching on the bread and butter and the chicken leg. Jeff’s eyes drop from the room of the ballet dancer to the one just underneath. She glances up, her attention caught by the music, and with a calm, practiced routine, adjusts the volume of her hearing aid. She possesses a faded, refined elegance. The melody is simple yet fragmented, as if someone were just beginning to learn the piano or was carefully composing a song. At this moment, we can hear the sounds of a piano being played. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he observes. The new music irritates Jeff slightly as he looks in its direction. On the second floor, a man enters the living room through a hallway door. We observe a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment building. He carries with him a large aluminum sample case, the type typically used by salesmen.

Jeff, now alert and intrigued, asks eagerly. The woman gracefully moves across the room in a perfectly synchronized rhythm with the music and dance, making her way toward the ice box. The camera focuses intently on the window of the small building where earlier, we had seen the girl positioned behind the oscillating fan. Loud, powerful ballet music is pouring vigorously from her open window. She begins the first graceful movements of a modern ballet interpretation. Her feet continue moving as she dramatically throws open the door, rhythmically returning to the center of the room, and gnaws on a chicken bone, occasionally waving it theatrically in the air as part of her choreography. Now, she twirls elegantly over toward a table located on the opposite side of the room, where an open package of bread slices lies, accompanied by some butter situated nearby. The girl, now attired in a dark, form-fitting leotard and ballet slippers, has just turned away from a portable record player. With a swaying, fluid motion, she sets down the chicken leg and gracefully butters a slice of bread. Picking up both the bread and chicken leg, she continues her interpretive dance, alternating between munching on the bread and butter and the chicken leg. Jeff’s eyes then drop from the room of the ballet dancer to the one just underneath. She glances up, her attention caught by the music, and with a calm, practiced routine, she adjusts the volume of her hearing aid. She possesses a faded, refined elegance. The melody is simple yet fragmented, sounding as if someone were just beginning to learn the piano or was carefully composing a new song. At this moment, we can distinctly hear the sounds of a piano being played. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he observes. The new music irritates Jeff slightly as he looks in its direction. On the second floor, a man enters the living room through a hallway door. We observe a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment building. He carries with him a large aluminum sample case, the type typically used by salesmen in their trade.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: At this moment, his gaze is naturally drawn across the way to a distant spectacle. While Jeff continues speaking into his phone, maintaining his conversation seamlessly, his attention is clearly captivated by what he's observing. His eyes widen slightly, and his eyebrows lift with an air of anticipation as he looks upward. The expression on his face unmistakably shows a nearly childlike eagerness. Across the way, two attractive young women have emerged onto a distant rooftop, their presence immediately taking center stage in Jeff's world. They are animatedly smiling and chatting with each other, their laughter and words are inaudible from this distance. Each of them is adorned in a comfortable terrycloth robe. With their backs facing the camera, they slowly slip the robes down from their shoulders, letting them cascade smoothly to the floor in a gesture that seems almost rehearsed. Afterward, they artfully arrange the robes before themselves, a makeshift blanket, before reclining out of sight on the roof. This small scene wholly captures Jeff's attention, creating a clear focal point in his otherwise monotonous afternoon. The slight sag of his shoulders indicates Jeff's disappointment as the intriguing tableau vanishes from view. His eyes scan the surroundings, seeking out the next source of neighborhood entertainment with renewed curiosity. He discovers another though-provoking occurrence in his backyard vista that diverts his focus. With a clear eagerness in his tone, Jeff inquires further, his senses heightened. Meanwhile, another scene unfolds as she glides smoothly across her apartment room, moving as if music itself carries her feet, dancing to an unheard melody on her way to the icebox. The camera diligently shifts focus, capturing the window of a quaint building where the girl was previously glimpsed behind the oscillating fan. From her open window, the powerful strains of loud ballet music blast into the open air. She commences the first delicate movements, embodying the essence of a modern ballet interpretation with each step. Her feet never cease their rhythmic motion as she energetically throws open the door. Then she gracefully returns to the room's center, incorporating a chicken bone into her dance, gnawing on it before waving it rhythmically like a conductor's baton. She twirls elegantly toward a table on the room's opposite side, where an open package of bread slices and a pat of butter await her. Now attired in a form-fitting, dark, and provocatively designed leotard paired with ballet slippers, she has just spun away from her portable record player. As her body sways with precision, she lays down the chicken leg, seamlessly transitioning to buttering a slice of bread with continued grace and rhythm. Holding both the bread and chicken leg, she resumes her interpretive dance, alternating between bites of the buttered bread and the chicken leg, her performance a perfect harmony of movement and sustenance. Meanwhile, Jeff's focus shifts downward from the dancer's room to the one directly below. Here, another woman, who exudes a faded elegance and refined demeanor, sits. She looks upwards in the direction of the music's source, and with practiced, routine precision, adjusts the volume of her hearing aid, her actions calm and methodical. The music transitions into a simple, fragmented melody, reminiscent of someone just beginning to learn piano or cautiously composing a new song. At this juncture, the soft, sporadic sounds of piano playing are audible, drawing Jeff's gaze outward across the adjacent apartments as he takes in the unfolding scene. The unfamiliar melody begins to irk Jeff slightly, prompting a change in his expression as he turns to view the origin of the new sound. On the second floor, a man enters his living room through a hallway door, becoming the newest focal point of interest. The setting reveals a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment house, the backdrop to this intricate tableau. The man carries with him a large aluminum sample case, the quintessential accessory for a traveling salesman, hinting at yet another story waiting to unfold in this maze of interconnected lives.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: At this moment, Jeff's attention shifts to something across the way while he continues his phone conversation. He looks up with a hint of eagerness as he observes two pretty girls on a distant roof, smiling and talking. Clad in terrycloth robes, they slip them off slowly and lie down out of sight, capturing all of Jeff's attention and leaving him slightly disappointed. Jeff then spots another scene in the neighborhood. His interest piqued, he watches as a woman moves gracefully across her room in time with loud ballet music blaring from her open window. She performs a modern ballet, integrating the rhythms of the choreography as she moves to the icebox, retrieves a chicken leg, and nibbles on it while dancing back to the room's center. Twirling toward a table, she gracefully butters a slice of bread, mirroring the rhythm of her dance, and alternates between eating bread and chicken. Jeff's gaze shifts from her room to the one below, where a refined woman reacts to the music by adjusting her hearing aid. At this moment, the sound of a piano melody begins, capturing Jeff's attention as he scans the other apartments. His irritation grows as he notices the source: a man enters a second-floor living room with a large aluminum sample case typical of salesmen. The camera captures a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment house as the scene unfolds.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: At this moment, his attention is drawn to something across the way. While Jeff, who works as a photojournalist capturing compelling stories, is continuing his phone conversation, we see the object of his look. He looks up, expectantly. There is almost a touch of eagerness in his expression. Two pretty girls have appeared on the distant roof of a charming building in a bustling neighborhood. They are smiling and talking, although we cannot hear their dialogue, typical of warm summer days when rooftops become social spots in the city. Each wears a terrycloth robe, a popular choice for sunbathers because of its gentle absorbency. With their backs to the camera, they take off the robes, slipping them down over their shoulders slowly, a common practice to catch the sun's rays evenly. Then they spread the robes in front of them, and lie down on the roof, and out of sight. They at least have all of Jeff's attention. Jeff seems a little disappointed, his curiosity piqued by the sudden absence. Jeff's eyes become set upon something else in the neighborhood he sees. Jeff's attention is now drawn to another feature of his backyard entertainment, a scene reminiscent of his childhood memories in the same area. Jeff asks, eagerly and alertly. She, an aspiring dancer known locally for her unique performances, gracefully moves across the room to the rhythm of the music and dance, toward the ice box, a vintage model from the 1950s. The camera is now focused on the window of the small building where we earlier saw the girl behind the oscillating fan, a relic from an era before air conditioning was widespread. Loud ballet music, echoing famous compositions of Tchaikovsky, is pouring from her open window. She begins the first graceful movement of a modern ballet interpretation. With her feet still moving, she throws open the door, and then rhythmically moving back to the center of the room, gnaws the chicken bone, occasionally waving it in the air as part of the choreography, a creative improvisation adding humor to her routine. She now twirls over toward a table at the other side of the room on which is an open package of bread slices, some butter nearby, staples in many households. The girl, now dressed in dark and revealing leotard, and ballet slippers designed for optimal movement, has just turned away from a portable record player, a beloved device for music lovers before digital playlists. With swaying body, she puts down the chicken leg, and gracefully and rhythmically butters a slice of bread. She picks up both bread and chicken leg and continues her interpretive dance, alternately munching the bread and butter and chicken leg, her actions an amusing blend of art and spontaneity. Jeff's eyes drop from the ballet dancer's room to the one underneath, the lively scene above contrasted by the stillness below. She looks up in the direction of the music and in a calm routine fashion adjusts the volume of her hearing aid, a device that has significantly improved her quality of life. She is a faded, refined type, reminiscent of an era of old Hollywood glamour. It is a simple, but broken, melody as if someone was just learning to play the piano, or carefully composing a song, invoking the struggles of every aspiring musician. At this moment we hear the sounds of a piano playing, a gentle serenade drifting through the air. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he sees. It irritates Jeff as he looks in the direction of the new music, perhaps a change from the melodies he's accustomed to. On the second floor, a man has entered the living room from a hallway door, his demeanor suggesting a long day. We see a three-storied, flat-roofed apartment house, characteristic of mid-20th-century urban architecture. He carries a large aluminum sample case common to salesmen, who often travel from door to door offering their wares.

Loud ballet music is pouring from her open window. She begins the first graceful movement of a modern ballet interpretation. With her feet still moving she throws open the door and then rhythmically moving back to the center of the room gnaws the chicken bone occasionally waving it in the air as part of the choreography. She now twirls over toward a table at the other side of the room on which is an open package of bread slices some butter nearby. The girl now dressed in dark and revealing leotard and ballet slippers has just turned away from a portable record player. With swaying body she puts down the chicken leg and gracefully and rhythmically butters a slice of bread. She picks up both bread and chicken leg and continues her interpretive dance alternately munching the bread and butter and chicken leg. Jeff's eyes drop from the ballet dancer's room to the one underneath. She looks up in the direction of the music and in a calm routine fashion adjusts the volume of her hearing aid. She is a faded refined type. It is a simple but broken melody as if someone was just learning to play the piano or carefully composing a song. At this moment we hear the sounds of a piano playing. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he sees. It irritates Jeff as he looks in the direction of the new music. On the second floor a man has entered the living room from a hallway door. We see a threestoried flatroofed apartment house. He carries a large aluminum sample case common to salesmen.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: At this moment his attention is drawn to something across the way. While Jeff is continuing his phone conversation we see the object of his look. He looks up expectantly. There is almost a touch of eagerness in his expression. Two pretty girls have appeared on the distant roof. They are smiling and talking although we cannot hear their dialogue. Each wears a terrycloth robe. With their backs to the camera they take off the robes slipping them down over their shoulders slowly. She looks up in the direction of the music and in a calm routine fashion adjusts the volume of her hearing aid. She is a faded refined type. It is a simple but broken melody as if someone was just learning to play the piano or carefully composing a song. At this moment we hear the sounds of a piano playing. Jefferies glances out across to the other apartments as he sees. It irritates Jeff as he looks in the direction of the new music. On the second floor a man has entered the living room from a hallway door. We see a threestoried flatroofed apartment house. He carries a large aluminum sample case common to salesmen.

It irritates Jeff as he looks in the direction of the new music. On the second floor a man has entered the living room from a hallway door. We see a threestoried flatroofed apartment house. He carries a large aluminum sample case common to salesmen.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: At this juncture, his curiosity is diverted to something beyond the garden. While Carl is maintaining his puzzle assembly, we catch a glimpse of the essence of his gaze. He glances upward, inquisitively. There is almost a hint of curiosity in his demeanor. Two colorful parrots have landed on the nearby tower. They are chuckling and squawking, although we cannot discern their chatter. Each sports a satin cape. With their wings to the breeze, they shrug off the capes, sliding them down over their feathers gradually. Then they unfurl the capes before them, and perch on the tower, and out of view. They certainly capture all of Carl's interest. Carl feels a tad bewildered. Carl's gaze becomes focused on something different in the alley he notices. Carl’s curiosity is now tugged toward another component of his garden amusement. Carl inquires, eagerly and watchfully. She delicately flutters over the patio to the melody of the tune and waltz, toward the lemonade stand. The lens is now centered on the portal of the little cottage where we earlier glimpsed the lady beside the spinning globe. Booming jazz tunes are flowing from her ajar entrance. She initiates the first nimble step of a contemporary jazz expression. With her wings still fluttering, she flings open the gate, and then methodically gliding back to the core of the patio, nibbles the corn cob, sporadically whisking it in the sky as part of the act. She now pirouettes over toward a pedestal at the far side of the patio on which rests an unopened can of olives, some honey adjacent. The lady, now adorned in bright and flowing gown, and tap shoes, has just pivoted away from a movable jukebox. With swaying figure, she sets aside the corn cob, and nimbly and methodically drizzles honey on an olive. She grasps both olives and corn cob and continues her expressive sequence, intermittently chewing the honeyed olives and corn cob. Carl's gaze shifts from the jazz performer's patio to the one beneath. She glances upward toward the rhythm and in a composed procedure manner adjusts the temperature of her iced tea. She is a worn, elegant figure. It is a basic, but fractured, tune as if someone was just mastering to strum the guitar, or thoughtfully crafting a sonnet. At this moment we perceive the echoes of a guitar strumming. Carl peers out across to the other houses as he discerns. It bothers Carl as he peers in the direction of the fresh melody. On the second tier, a cat has sauntered into the parlor from an attic hatch. We notice a tri-level, steep-roofed cabin. It hauls a petite wooden picnic basket typical of hikers.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jeff's attention shifts from his phone call to two girls on a distant roof, who catch his interest as they disrobe and lie down, capturing his full focus. Disappointed when they vanish from view, Jeff redirects his gaze to a new scene: a woman inside her apartment performing a modern ballet to loud music. She dances gracefully, incorporating a chicken leg and bread into her routine. As Jeff observes these events, his attention is drawn to another apartment where a woman adjusts her hearing aid, hinting at a simple piano melody from another source. This music bothers Jeff, who notices a man carrying a large salesman's case entering an apartment on the second floor.
